technical_features.source_sentence: The device showed an outstanding EQE of 21.4%, which is comparable to that of the best Cd-chalcogenide-based QLEDs (Figure 1f).
InP/ZnSe/ZnS red QLEDs [...] showed high external quantum efficiency (EQE) similar to their theoretical limits as well as high brightness with low turn-on voltages.
High-efficiency green-emitting InP QLEDs have been reported [...] with an EQE of 13.6%.
Green InP QLEDs [...] demonstrated a maximum luminance of 13,900 cd/m².
Blue-emitting heavy-metal-free QLEDs with an EQE of ∼20% have been reported using ZnSeTe/ZnS QDs.
ZnSeTe blue QLEDs achieved a maximum luminance of 88,900 cd/m².
QLEDs could be fabricated as an ultrathin-type device whose entire thickness is <3 μm including encapsulation layers.
Samsung Advanced Institute of Technology demonstrated a 4″-scale flexible full-color QD display by combining 413 ppi RGB QLEDs with an oxide transistor array.
High-quality type I core/shell QDs [...] exhibit [...] high-photoluminescence quantum yield (PLQY, typically 70–100% for CdSe/ZnS QDs).
The spectral width being 25 nm is just narrow enough to enable nearly visually indistinguishable color gamut from laser displays.

qualitative_insights.main_objective: Advance development of full-color electroluminescent quantum dot displays by improving QLED performance and patterning techniques
key_methodology_summary: QD synthesis optimization (core-shell engineering, surface passivation)
Device structure design (ZnO NP electron transport layers, organic hole transport layers)
Patterning techniques: photolithography, inkjet printing, transfer printing
primary_findings_conclusions: Achieved 21.4% EQE in InP red QLEDs and 20.2% EQE in ZnSeTe blue QLEDs
Demonstrated pixelated RGB arrays via transfer printing
Identified inter-QD energy transfer as key challenge for white emission
limitations_discussed_by_authors: Lower efficiency in green InP QLEDs vs red/blue
novelty_significance_claim: First demonstration of heavy-metal-free QLEDs with near-theoretical efficiencies
Ultra-thin (<3 μm) form factor enables wearable integration
Potential for VR/AR displays matching human eye resolution
key_tables_figures_present: Table 1: Performance metrics of heavy-metal-free QLEDs
Figure 1: Device architectures and efficiency progress
Figure 3: Application examples in flexible/wearable devices
